articles.title: South Korean Permanent Resident in U.S. Arrested for His Illegal Entry into DPRK
articles.content:
South Korean Permanent Resident in U.S. Arrested for His Illegal Entry into DPRK
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- South Korean resident in the U.S. Won Moon Joo, 21, student of New York University, was arrested while illegally entering the DPRK after crossing the Amnok River from Dandong, China on April 22. He is a permanent resident in 56 C Westervelt Avenue, Tenafly, New Jersey, U.S. 
					 He is now under investigation by a competent institution of the DPRK. He admitted that his illegal entry was a serious violation of the law of the DPRK.

articles.title: Delegation of Korean Medical Workers in U.S. Here
articles.content:
Delegation of Korean Medical Workers in U.S. Here
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- A delegation of Korean medical workers in the U.S. headed by Pak Ki Bom arrived here on Saturday to take part in the 17th Pyongyang symposium on medical science of Koreans at home and abroad.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Returns Home
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Returns Home
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Oil Industry of the DPRK led by Minister Pae Hak came back home on Saturday after visiting Russia.

articles.title: International Women's Grand March to Be Held in DPRK
articles.content:
International Women's Grand March to Be Held in DPRK
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The 2015 international women's grand march for Korea's reunification and peace will be held in the DPRK in May, 2015.
					 The Korean Committee for Solidarity with the World People and other social organizations in the DPRK formed the preparatory committee in Pyongyang and are working for successful international women's grand march.
					
					 The grand march will encourage the Korean people in their efforts to pave a broad avenue to independent reunification on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation and contribute to joining the international community in its efforts for reunification and peace on the Korean peninsula.

articles.title: Lettuce Good for Health
articles.content:
Lettuce Good for Health
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Lettuce is one of vegetables that the Koreans have cultivated away back the middle ages.
					 It is very good to whet appetite in such hot weather as now, Dr. Pak Hyong Bom of the Life Science Faculty of Kim Il Sung University told KCNA, adding:
					
					 An old book of China says that lettuce seed presented by an envoy of Koryo Kingdom (918-1392) is worth a thousand pounds.
					
					 The Koreans have taken lettuce with peppered bean paste to stimulate their appetite and stand the hot weather in the period from spring to autumn.
					
					 Lettuce contains vitamins A, B1 and C, calcium, iron and essential amino acid. Its moderate intake helps prevent anemia, but excessive intake produces a bad effect on parturient women and infants.
					
					 In recent years Okryu Restaurant and other catering service establishments in the country have served dishes made with lettuce.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Slams U.S.-sponsored Anti-DPRK "Human Rights Seminar"
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Slams U.S.-sponsored Anti-DPRK "Human Rights Seminar"
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The U.S. mission at the United Nations sponsored a "seminar on human rights in north Korea" on April 30. 
					 It brought together the "special envoy for the human rights issue in north Korea" of the U.S. Department of State, representatives of the U.S. and south Korea in the UN, the assistant secretary general in charge of human rights of the UN and human scum of all hues on the payroll of the U.S. 
					
					 The assistant secretary general vociferated about the "human rights issue" in the DPRK and "defectors from north Korea" made "testimonies."
					
					 Great irony was that the U.S. charade aimed at building public opinion on the non-existent "human rights issue" through "those defectors" proved abortive after being criticized and derided by its attendants. 
					
					 Before its beginning the representative of the DPRK asked the U.S. for a floor as the party concerned, but it turned down his request and persistently tried to lead the "seminar" as intended by it. 
					
					 When "defectors from north Korea" were making "testimonies," the DPRK side became vocal revealing the sinister political purpose of the U.S. anti-DPRK "human rights" racket and true colors of the "defectors." The U.S. asked the DPRK side to calm down, saying that it would give the floor before the seminar was over. Much upset by this, the U.S. representative at the UN went reckless, calling on the secretariat to disconnect mike and threatening to call police. 
					
					 Strange things happened in the hall. Some of the "defectors" stood up and made odd shouts. They were not able to properly read English texts of speeches written by the U.S. only to become a laughing stock in the hall. This once again brought to light vulgar efforts of the U.S. to hype and internationalize the "human rights issue" and the true nature of the anti-DPRK "human rights" racket. 
					
					 By staging the recent "seminar" the U.S. took one more infamous step in the anti-DPRK "human rights" racket kicked up in the international arena including the UN with the above-said "defectors" involved. 
					
					 As already reported, the U.S. wooed the UN General Assembly and the UN Human Rights Council into adopting anti-DPRK "human rights resolutions" on the basis of "testimonies" made by "defectors from north Korea" last year and this year. 
					
					 But when one "defector" who was the main testifier admitted that he made false testimony, the "human rights issue" much touted by the U.S. proved to be a fabrication in the eyes of the world community. 
					
					 The recent "seminar on human rights" goes to prove that how desperately the U.S. is working to tarnish the dignity and image of the DPRK by citing fictitious "human rights issue" and invent a pretext for interfering in the internal affairs of the DPRK and launching aggression against it. 
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that the UN is allowing the prestige and honor of the world body to be defamed, oblivious of its mission and duty and taken in by false testimonies of human scum, under the U.S. command and manipulation though it should enjoy trust by ensuring equal sovereignty and international impartiality. 
					
					 The UN let its assistant secretary general take part in the political "seminar" against its member nation and make reckless remarks in favor of the U.S. This eloquently proves that the principle of objectivity and impartiality, which keep the UN alive, is violated and the UN arena has turned into a theatre of rowdyism of political tricksters and confrontation. 
					
					 All the facts once again warn that the U.S. and the UN will face bitterer disgrace and more vehement international criticism if they go reckless, harboring criminals and "defectors from north Korea".

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for More Dynamically Advancing toward Sports Power House
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for More Dynamically Advancing toward Sports Power House
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Saturday editorially calls upon all the people to more dynamically advance toward the finish line for building a sports power house full of conviction of certain victory and optimism.
					 The building of a sports power house is the one front to which the Workers' Party of Korea is attaching importance in the drive to build a thriving socialist nation, the editorial says, and goes on:
					
					 The eye-catching achievements made in the sports field in recent years, a great enthusiasm for sporting running high across the country and the appearance of lots of modern sports and cultural facilities in Pyongyang and other parts of the country prove that the party's plan for building a sports power house is being translated into realities.
					
					 The sportspersons and other people should more dynamically advance toward the finish line for building a sports power house, bearing in mind the slogan "Let us rush forward towards the finish line of building a sports power in the revolutionary spirit of Paektu!" put up by the party.
					
					 All sportspersons should continue creating the admirable myth of sports of heroic Korea at international games by devoting all their wisdom and energies in the revolutionary spirit of Paektu, the spirit of the blizzards of Paektu.
					
					 All the people should love sports, make it part of their everyday life and make a hot wind of sports rage everywhere.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Accuses Puppet Chief Executive of Driving Political Situation into Confusion
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Accuses Puppet Chief Executive of Driving Political Situation into Confusion
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hangyore on April 28 carried an article accusing the puppet chief executive of driving the political situation into confusion.
					 After returning home from her foreign tour the chief executive did not make her public appearance under the pretext of "fatigue" and the like, the editorial charged.
					
					 Park Geun Hye should frankly admit her wrongdoings and make an apology to the people, it said, and went on:
					
					 She should bow to the people as her close confidants were involved in the Song Wan Jong case.

articles.title: S. Korean Inhabitants Protest against U.S. War Drills
articles.content:
S. Korean Inhabitants Protest against U.S. War Drills
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Villagers near a firing range of the U.S. forces in Phochon, Kyonggi Province held a rally in Seoul on April 29 in protest against the indiscriminative war drills staged by the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces threatening the life and security of the south Korean people, according to MBC of south Korea.
					 Speakers deplored that shells fired by the U.S. forces at the Yongphyong firing range dropped on villages at irregular intervals, throwing inhabitants into uneasiness and horror.
					
					 Forest fire occurred on a hill around the firing range due to a shell fired by U.S. forces on March 14.
					
					 A shell fired at the firing range dropped on Sohoesan-ri, Yongbuk-myon, Phochon City on April 22 and a shell went through the ceiling of a house in a village in Yami-ri, Yongbuk-myon on April 28.

articles.title: Young S. Koreans Stage Action against Chief Executive
articles.content:
Young S. Koreans Stage Action against Chief Executive
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Young south Koreans staged a demonstration in Seoul on April 28 in demand of the resignation of the puppet regime.
					 Park Geun Hye started her foreign tour for no reason in the wake of the disclosure of the issue of the illegal funds for the "presidential election," they said, adding this shows she had no willingness to own responsibility for it.
					
					 They scattered hundreds of leaflets calling for the judgment of the puppet regime.
					
					 When they marched toward Chongwadae, police walked off all of them.
					
					 Meanwhile, social activist Pak Song Su and other members of various organizations held a press conference outside the puppet Supreme Prosecutor's Office.
					
					 In case Park Geun Hye is mentioned in leaflets, the present regime is cracking down upon protestors on charge of "libel," they charged.
					
					 At the end of the conference they conducted information service condemning the security forces for blocking the anti-Park Geun Hye action.
					
					 Upset by this, the puppet forces walked off Pak Song Su on charges of the violation of the "law on assembly and demonstration".

articles.title: Thorough Investigation into Song Wan Jong Case Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Thorough Investigation into Song Wan Jong Case Demanded in S. Korea
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- 14 civic organizations of south Korea including the Citizens Federation for Economic Justice and the Citizens Solidarity for Democratic Society held a press conference in Seoul on April 28 demanding the puppet prosecution make a thoroughgoing investigation into the Song Wan Jong case.
					 Speakers said that the prosecution should not investigate only those who would bring less burden to the "president" but make a thoroughgoing investigation into all those involved in the scandal as exposed by Song Wan Jong.
					
					 Eight persons involved in the scandal are telling lies and core witnesses are appeased or handled without any trace left, they charged.
					
					 The prosecution should investigate not only Ri Wan Gu, former "prime minister", and Hong Jun Phyo, a lawmaker from the "Saenuri Party" who is governor of the South Kyongsang Province, but also six others.

articles.title: Thoroughgoing Investigation into Illegal Political Funds Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Thoroughgoing Investigation into Illegal Political Funds Demanded in S. Korea
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Religionists of the Masan Parish of the south Korean Catholicism held a press conference in front of the South Kyongsang Provincial Office on April 28 in demand of a thoroughgoing investigation into the Song Wan Jong case.
					 Speakers held that an investigation into the Park Geun Hye's illegal funds for "presidential election" should be strictly conducted without delay.

articles.title: Halt to Military Nexus Aimed at Preemptive Nuclear Strike on North Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Halt to Military Nexus Aimed at Preemptive Nuclear Strike on North Demanded in S. Korea
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in south Korea held the 156th rally for peace and disarmament outside the puppet Ministry of Defense on April 28.
					 Speakers said that the talks between foreign and defense ministers of the U.S. and Japan on April 27 finally confirmed the revision of the "U.S-Japan defense cooperation guidelines" which makes it possible for Japan "Self-Defense Forces" to conduct joint military operations with the U.S. forces without any restriction.
					
					 They accused the puppet Ministry of Defense of south Korea of claiming that it is not chiefly responsible for the "U.S.-Japan defense cooperation guidelines."
					
					 They urged the ministry to clarify its stand of rejecting the revision of the above-said guidelines and Japan's exercise of the "right to collective self-defense".
					
					 They demanded a halt to the dangerous military nexus aimed to mount a preemptive nuclear strike at the north.

articles.title: U.S. Denounced for Paving Way for S. Korea's Nuclear Weaponization
articles.content:
U.S. Denounced for Paving Way for S. Korea's Nuclear Weaponization
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Recently the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces concluded the negotiations for revising the "atomic energy agreement". Under this agreement south Korea is allowed to enrich uranium and reprocess the spent nuclear fuel. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday observes in a commentary in this regard: 
					
					 The revised "agreement," the U.S. criminal act of paving the way for south Korea's nuclear weaponization, is little short of a dangerous gambling as it escalates the nuclear arms race and increases the danger of a nuclear war on the Korean peninsula and in the rest of Northeast Asia to an extreme pitch.
					
					 By revising the "agreement" the U.S. made south Korean puppet forces' development of nukes legal, self-exposing that it is the main nuclear proliferator and the arch criminal creating a nuclear crisis on the Korean peninsula, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. and south Korean puppet forces should be brought to justice for their nuclear proliferation but they are pulling up the DPRK over its "nuclear threat" and "nuclear proliferation." This is like a thief crying "Stop the thief!"
					
					 The prevailing grave situation once again goes to prove that the DPRK took a just option to consolidate nuclear deterrence for self-defense as firm as a rock, guided by its own viewpoint and faith. 
					
					 The U.S. and south Korean puppet forces have neither qualifications nor face to take issue with the DPRK's measures for bolstering up its nuclear deterrence.

articles.title: Mammoth Rallies, Demonstrations Staged in South Korea
articles.content:
Mammoth Rallies, Demonstrations Staged in South Korea
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Large-scale anti-"government" actions of labor circle were staged in south Korea on Friday, May Day.
					 The Confederation of Trade Unions held a rally at Seoul Square putting up slogan "End to Park Geun Hye".
					
					 It was attended by at least 50,000 workers under the confederation and more than 200 bereaved family members of the ferry Sewol disaster.
					
					 Han Sang Gyun, chairman of the confederation, declared it would fight to put an end to the Park corrupt regime, not yielding to any threat.
					
					 Yu Kyong Gun, executive chairman of the April 16 Family Consultative Council, noted it would join members of the confederation in actions.
					
					 At the end of the rally the participants staged demonstrations, shouting slogan "Park regime step down!"
					
					 Meanwhile, there took place a rally in Youido, Seoul denouncing the puppet authorities for retrogressively revising the structure of labor market with at least 120,000 workers under the Federation of Trade Unions attending.
					
					 Speakers deplored that the reality of south Korea is becoming more disastrous and miserable and there is neither hope nor future.
					
					 That day members of the Government Employees Union staged a strike in Seoul in protest against the Park group's moves to retrogressively revise pension for government employees.

articles.title: S. Korean Peasants' Actions against Puppet Forces' Misrule Supported
articles.content:
S. Korean Peasants' Actions against Puppet Forces' Misrule Supported
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Voice of People, an internet paper of south Korea, in an editorial on April 29 supported the south Korean peasants in their actions against the puppet forces' misrule.
					The editorial recalled that the Federation of Peasants Associations held a meeting at which it vowed to hold a 100,000-peasant rally for defense of the food sovereignty and change of the regime in November.
					
					 The agriculture on this land is facing a ruin and peasants' vital rights are being ruthlessly trampled down due to the moves of the U.S.-led Trans-Pacific Partnership (TPP) in the wake of the regime's opening of rice market, it charged.
					
					 Positive actions of people of various strata are being waged to win the vital rights and defend agriculture, it said, and went on:
					
					 The 100 000-peasant rally slated for November heralds the start of the people's action for bringing down the regime together with the workers' general strike.
					
					 Oppression is bound to be accompanied with a struggle.
					
					 The 100 000 peasants' actions for ensuring prices for farm produce, protecting the food sovereignty and bringing down the corrupt and incompetent regime will sweep south Korea.

articles.title: Chongryon Officials Meet
articles.content:
Chongryon Officials Meet
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- A meeting of officials of six headquarters in Kanto area and organizations of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) took place at the Korean Hall in Tokyo on April 24 to successfully greet the grand festival of Koreans in Japan for celebrating the 60th anniversary of the formation of Chongryon.
					 Present there were Chairman Ho Jong Man and vice-chairpersons of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, the chairman of the Central Audit Committee of Chongryon, department directors, officials of Chongryon organizations and those of its headquarters.
					
					 Speakers referred to the achievements and experience made in the work of units to greet the 60th anniversary of Chongryon with successes in making a leap forward toward a new heyday.
					
					 They said that all officials of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan would turn out as one to greet the grand festival with success and demonstrate the might of Chongryon.
					
					 Ho Jong Man said that the grand festival is a springboard from which to glorify the feats President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il performed by leading Chongryon and help the work of Chongryon make a leap forward in the glorious era of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He called upon all officials to give a steady continuity to the proud history of Chongryon firm in tradition and great in succession as desired by Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: KPA Founding Anniversary Observed by Austrian Body
articles.content:
KPA Founding Anniversary Observed by Austrian Body
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The Group of Youth for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea in Vienna, Austria released a bulletin on Apr. 24 to mark the 83rd anniversary of the founding of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 The bulletin in an article titled "Korean People's Army guaranteeing sovereignty of DPRK."
					
					 President Kim Il Sung founded the revolutionary armed forces on Apr. 25, 1932 and defeated the Japanese imperialist invaders on Aug. 15, 1945, liberating the country.
					
					 When the U.S. imperialists provoked the Korean war on June 25, 1950, the KPA beat back their aggression and won a victory under the leadership of the President.
					
					 The U.S. has frantically staged war drills against the DPRK, oblivious of the lesson drawn from its defeat but the peace on the Korean peninsula is creditably ensured thanks to the KPA.
					
					 Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un has ceaselessly inspected KPA units and showed warm loving care for soldiers, carrying forward the cause of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The service personnel of the KPA are fully determined to defend their supreme commander and the socialist homeland at the cost of their lives.

articles.title: Birthday of KPA Observed Abroad
articles.content:
Birthday of KPA Observed Abroad
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Papers of Zimbabwe and Namibia carried articles to mark the 83rd founding anniversary of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 The Zimbabwean paper Herald on Apr. 24 carried an article titled "Exploits performed for peace" illustrated with portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Noting the KPA has covered a proud path of victory and glory along with the Songun revolution for over 80 years, the article said that under the guidance of the President it won the two revolutionary wars and foiled every provocation of the U.S. in the post-war period, too.
					
					 Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission, held higher the banner of Songun in the worst adversity when the imperialist allied forces' political and military offensive was focused on the DPRK with the collapse of socialism in East European countries as a momentum at the end of the last century, it said, adding:
					
					 It was none other than Kim Jong Il who protected global peace and security from the imperialists' aggression, high-handed and arbitrary practices with his original Songun politics.
					
					 The great exploits performed by him for the world peace will always be remembered by humankind and the KPA's history of victory will be given steady continuity for all ages.
					
					 The Namibian paper New Era on Apr. 23 carried an article titled "80 odd years along with Songun revolution."

articles.title: Day of Sun Marked by Syrian Media
articles.content:
Day of Sun Marked by Syrian Media
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Syrian media carried special write-ups from April 13 to 19 to mark the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun).
					 The Syria TV Channel aired a detailed program dealing with the exploits Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il performed by consolidating the DPRK as an invulnerable socialist fortress under the uplifted banner of the Juche idea, Songun idea, and working heart and soul to reunify the country till the last moments of their lives. It was illustrated with photos documenting their revolutionary activities.
					
					 The Syrian central radio broadcasting service aired a special program praising the exploits performed by the President before the times and history.
					
					 The Sana News Agency praised his revolutionary career.
					
					 The paper Tishrin edited an article titled "Celebration of birth anniversary of DPRK President Kim Il Sung," illustrated with a portrait of the smiling President.
					
					 The paper Al Baath in an article titled "Eternal sun" referred to the fact that his noble personality and tenderness touched not only the Korean people but also many other people in the world.
					
					 A paper also carried an article introducing his noble traits.
					
					 The paper Al Thawrah carried an article titled "Celebration of birth anniversary of HE Kim Il Sung, founder of the DPRK."

articles.title: Brief Biography of Kim Il Sung Carried by Austrian Bulletin
articles.content:
Brief Biography of Kim Il Sung Carried by Austrian Bulletin
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Brief biography of President Kim Il Sung was carried by the Group of Youth for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea in Vienna, Austria in its bulletin on April 24.
					 It was illustrated with a portrait of smiling Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Detenido en RPDC ciudadano norteamericano
articles.content:
Detenido en RPDC ciudadano norteamericano
Pyongyang, 2 de mayo (ACNC) -- El ciudadano norteamericano oriundo del Sur de Corea, Won Moon Joo (Varon de 21 anos de edad, residente en el numero C-56 de la avenida Westervelt de la ciudad Tenafly del Estado New Jersey de Estados Unidos), estudiante de la Universidad de New York, fue detenido el 22 de abril cuando entraba ilegalmente en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea cruzando el rio Amnok desde Dandong de China.
					Actualmente el organo correspondiente de la RPDC realiza la investigacion sobre Joo y este reconocio que sus actos son grave crimen que viola la ley de la RPDC.

articles.title: ACNC critica campaña de "DDHH" anti-RPDC en la ONU
articles.content:
ACNC critica campaña de "DDHH" anti-RPDC en la ONU
Pyongyang, 2 de mayo (ACNC) -- El 30 de abril en la ONU se efectuó en la sede de la ONU el intrigante "seminario de derechos humanos" contra la República Popular Democrática de Corea, auspiciado por la representación estadounidense en esta organización internacional.
					Según trascendidos, en el seminario participaron el "enviado especial encargado de los derechos humanos" del Departamento de Estado norteamericano, los representantes norteamericano y surcoreano en la ONU, el asistente del secretario general de los derechos humanos de la ONU y la chusma de varios tipos arrastrada por Estados Unidos, ocasión en la cual el asistente parloteó sobre los "problemas de DDHH" de la RPDC y hubo "testimonios de los fugitivos norcoreanos".
					
					Lo ridículo es que causaron burla y censura de todo el mundo las maniobras de EE.UU. tendentes a difundir el inexistente "problema de DDHH" de la RPDC en la sociedad internacional incitando a los "fugitivos norcoreanos".
					
					Antes del comienzo del simposio, EE.UU. no permitió para que hablara el representante de la RPDC aunque ésta lo demandó como parte interesada, y maniobró persistentemente para poner en marcha el "seminario" según su propósito.
					
					Cuando "testimonian los fugitivos norcoreanos", el representante de la RPDC reveló y condenó fuertemente la naturaleza de ellos y el malsano objetivo político de las maniobras de "DDHH" anti-RPDC de EE.UU.
					
					Entonces, la presidencia intentó detener la palabra de nuestro representante diciendo que le daría el derecho a hablar en la última etapa del seminario y el representante estadounidense, perplejo por ello, gritó perdiendo el juicio que la secretaria apagara el micrófono y llamara a la policía.
					
					Además los "fugitivos norcoreanos" se comportaron asquerosamente y no leyeron exactamente el guión de "testimonio" escrito en inglés por EE.UU., lo cual produjo la risa irónica y censura de todos.
					
					Así, se reveló otra vez la bajeza y la naturaleza de la campaña de "DDHH" anti-RPDC de EE.UU. encaminada a internacionalizar y extremar el "problema de DDHH" de la RPDC movilizando en colectivo a las escorias humanas en la ONU.
					
					El presente "seminario" es la edición ampliada de la campaña de DDHH anti-RPDC que lanzó EE.UU. en la ONU y otros escenarios internacionales involucrando a los "fugitivos norcoreanos".
					
					Al convocar la "reunión de alto nivel sobre los DDHH del Norte de Corea", dirigió detrás de la cortina la aprobación del "informe del Comité de Investigación" y la "resolución de DDHH" de la Asamblea General de la ONU a base de los "testimonios" de los "fugitivos norcoreanos" llenos de maldades y calumnias.
					
					En el "seminario de DDHH" efectuado el 17 de febrero en Washington, debatió la aprobación de "nueva resolución anticoreana" con motivo del primer aniversario de la publicación del "informe del comité de investigación" de la ONU sobre la situación de DDHH de la RPDC en el año pasado. En marzo, aprobó otra vez la "resolución de DDHH" anti-RPDC en la 28ª reunión del Consejo de DDHH de la ONU.
					
					Pero, el "fugitivo norcoreano", que se ofreció como "testigo" principal, reconoció que sus testimonios son falsos, así que se conoció en todo el mundo que el "problema de DDHH" de la RPDC, de que hablaba tanto EE.UU., no pasa de ser un invento fraudulento.
					
					A pesar de ello, EE.UU. volvió a abrir el "seminario de DDHH" en su desesperado intento de manchar la dignidad y la imagen de la RPDC y preparar el pretexto de intervención y agresión.
					
					No se puede soslayar el hecho de que lejos de su misión de garantizar la igualdad de soberanía de los países y la imparcialidad internacional, la ONU se gana la deshonra dejándose engañar por los testimonios falsos.
					
					La ONU envió al asistente del secretario general de la ONU al "seminario" político contra un país miembro para que pronunciara discurso como portavoz de la posición de EE.UU.
					
					Este hecho es una prueba de que la ONU se convirtió en una escena caótica de fraudes políticos y el campo de confrontación faltando a sus principios vitales de objetividad e imparcialidad.
					
					La realidad demuestra que si EE.UU. y la ONU siguen amparando a los "fugitivos norcoreanos", delincuentes y escorias humanas, sufrirán la vergüenza y la crítica más grandes en la arena internacional.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun critica enmienda de "Acuerdo de energia nuclear" de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun critica enmienda de "Acuerdo de energia nuclear" de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 2 de mayo (ACNC) -- Hace poco, EE.UU. y los titeres surcoreanos concluyeron las negociaciones sobre la enmienda del "Acuerdo de energia nuclear" y lo suscribieron provisionalmente. Esto permite a los titeres surcoreanos hacer el enriquecimiento de uranio y el reprocesamiento de combustible nuclear usado e impulsar el armamento nuclear. 
					Este proceder criminal promueve la carrera armamentista nuclear en la Peninsula Coreana y el resto del Nordeste Asiatico y aumenta al extremo el peligro de estallido de la guerra nuclear. 
					
					Revela asi el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual de este sabado y prosigue:
					
					Al atribuir al Sur de Corea la legitimidad del desarrollo de armas nucleares, EE.UU. mostro que el mismo es el autor de la proliferacion nuclear y el caudillo de la crisis nuclear en la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					Sin embargo, EE.UU. y los titeres surcoreanos acusan a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea de "amenaza nuclear" y "proliferacion nuclear", lo cual es una insistencia cinica igual a un incendiario que grita primero "!fuego!".
					
					La grave situacion actual comprueba una vez mas que es muy justa nuestra opcion por consolidar el disuasivo nuclear de autodefensa segun nuestro propio criterio y conviccion. 
					
					EE.UU. y los titeres surcoreanos no tienen la cara ni la calificacion para cuestionar el fortalecimiento del disuasivo nuclear de la RPDC.
